intro: Aeschynomene mollicula, commonly known as silky aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Aeschynomene mollicula is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
